{{also|Appendix:Variations of "um"}}
==Translingual==

===Symbol===
{{mul-symbol}}

# [[micrometer]]; variant of [[μm]] used when the character [[μ]] is unavailable

==English==
{{wikipedia|Speech disfluency}}

===Etymology 1===
{{onomatopoeic|en}}.

====Alternative forms====
* {{alt|en|umm|uhm|hum|erm}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|en|/ʌm/|/əːm/}}
* {{audio|en|en-us-um.ogg|a=US}}
* {{rhymes|en|ʌm|s=1}} (when stressed, or as a verb)
Used in [[rhotic]] dialects. Compare to British English {{m|en|erm}}.

====Interjection====
{{en-interj}}

# {{non-gloss|[[expression|Expression]] of [[hesitation]], [[uncertainty]] or space [[filler]] in [[conversation]]}}.
#: {{syn|en|er|hmm|uh}}
#: {{ux|en|'''Um''', I don’t know.}}
#: {{ux|en|Let’s see... '''um'''... how about this?}}
#* {{quote-text|en|year=2002|title=Newsweek|volume=140|page=lxxx
|passage=It's a great test of the claims of open-source gurus, who say that a self-motivated community can outcode any team working for a single employer—like, '''um''', Microsoft.}}
# {{lb|en|chiefly|American}} {{dated spelling of|en|mmm}}
#* {{quote-book|en|year=1963|author=w:Kurt Vonnegut|title=Cat's Cradle|publisher=Dell Publishing Co., Inc.|page=65
|passage="About the same, wherever you go," he agreed.<br>"'''Um'''," I said.}}
# {{lb|en|US}} {{non-gloss|An expression to forcefully call attention to something wrong.}}
#: {{ux|en|'''Um''', excuse me!}}
# {{lb|en|UK|childish}} An expression of shocked disapproval used by a child who witnesses forbidden behavior.
#* {{quote-text|en|year=2011|author=Kimberly Willis Holt|title=Piper Reed, Clubhouse Queen
|passage=While I was in her room, Sam walked by and said, “'''Um''', I'm telling!”<br>“You're telling what?” I asked.<br>“You're reading Tori's journal,” she said.}}
#* {{quote-book|en|year=2021|author=Sarah Strangeways|title=The Gingerbread House|page=13
|passage=Mair used to look after Laura. If anyone threatened to tease her, Mair would stand up straight, point her finger at the enemy and shout, ''''Um'''! I'm ''telling'' on you!'}}

====Verb====
{{en-verb}}

# {{lb|en|intransitive}} To make the ''um'' sound to express uncertainty or hesitancy.
#* {{quote-book|en|year=2007|author=Michael Erard|title=Um... Slips, Stumbles, and Verbal Blunders, and What They Mean|page=136|text=Meanwhile, in the popular mind '''umming''' was simply a bad habit, akin to spitting or picking one’s nose.}}

===Etymology 2===

====Particle====
{{en-part}}

# {{lb|en|dated|sometimes|humorous|often|offensive}} {{n-g|An undifferentiated determiner or article; a miscellaneous linking word, or filler with nonspecific meaning; representation of broken English stereotypically or comically attributed to Native Americans.}}
#: {{ux|en|He '''um''' Growling Bear. He '''um''' heap big chief.}}
#* {{quote-journal|en|year=1871|title=Grand camp meeting on Bear River|journal=The Keepapitchinin|page=3|text=“me heap brave—me talk to '''um''' white man so{{...}} me good injun, like '''um''' white man, ''mebbe so'', ugh!”|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GEFOAAAAYAAJ&pg=PP3|volume=III}}

==German==

===Alternative forms===
* {{alter|de|umb|ümb|üm||obsolete}}

===Etymology===
{{dercat|de|gem-pro|inh=1}}
From {{inh|de|gmh|umbe}}, {{m|gmh|ümbe}}, from {{inh|de|goh|umbi}}, from {{inh|de|gmw-pro|*umbi}}.

[[Central German]] dialects show regular umlaut; the standard form is from [[Upper German]], where umlaut of ''-u-'' was blocked before labial geminates and clusters. Cognate with {{cog|lb|ëm}}, {{cog|nl|om}}, {{cog|en|umbe}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|de|/ʊm/}}
* {{audio|de|De-um.ogg}}
* {{audio|de|De-um3.ogg}}
* {{audio|de|De-at-um.ogg|a=Austria}}
* {{rhymes|de|ʊm}}

===Preposition===
{{head|de|preposition}} {{+obj|de|acc}}

# [[about]]
#: {{uxi|de|Es geht '''um''' den Kuchen.|It's about the pie.}}
# [[around]]
#: {{uxi|de|'''Um''' die Ecke|around the corner}}
# [[at]], [[by]] {{qual|when relating to time}}
#: {{uxi|de|'''Um''' acht Uhr reisen wir ab|At eight o’clock we depart}}
# [[by]] {{qual|percentage difference}}
#: {{uxi|de|Die Verkaufsmengen gingen '''um''' 6% zurück.|Sales in volume has decreased by 6%.}}
# {{lb|de|Austria}} [[for]] {{qual|amount of money}}
#: {{uxi|de|'''Um''' einen Euro bekommt man heute nicht besonders viel.|You can't buy much for one euro these days.}}
#: {{uxi|de|Heute im Sonderangebot '''um''' nur 99 Euro.|Special offer today for only 99 euros.}}

====Derived terms====
* ('''''um''' + das'') {{l|de|ums}}

===Conjunction===
{{head|de|conjunction}} {{tlb|de|introduces a ''zu''-clause}}

# [[in order to]], [[so as to]]
#: {{ux|de|Wir sind gekommen, '''um''' zu helfen.|We’ve come ('''in order''') '''to''' help.}}

===Adjective===
{{de-adj|predonly}}

# {{lb|de|predicative|not attributive}} up, in the sense of finished
#: {{ux|de|Werden dich in kurzem binden/ [[w:Erdgeist|Erdgeist]], deine Zeit ist '''um'''|source=Friedrich von Hardenberg, ''Novalis''|We will shortly bind you/ Erdgeist, your time is up}}

===Adverb===
{{de-adv}}

# [[around]], [[about]]
# turned over, [[changed]], from one state to another

====Derived terms====
{{col3|de|um meinetwillen|um euretwillen|um Ihretwillen|um deinetwillen|um ihretwillen|um seinetwillen}}

==Icelandic==

===Alternative forms===
* {{alt|is|umb}}

===Etymology===
From {{inh|is|non|um}}, from {{inh|is|gem-pro|*umbi|t=around, about}}.

===Adverb===
{{head|is|adverb}}

# {{non-gloss|used in set phrases}}
#: {{ux|is|Það er [[um að gera|'''um''' að gera]] að sofa vel.|The important thing to do is to sleep well.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hvað er '''um''' að vera?|What's going on?}}
#: {{ux|is|Eins og '''um''' var talað.|As was agreed.}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|is|um að gera}}
* {{l|is|vera um og ó}}

===Preposition===
{{head|is|preposition}} {{+obj|is|acc}}

# [[about]], [[concerning]]
#: {{ux|is|'''Um''' hvað ertu að tala?|What are you talking '''about'''?}}
#: {{ux|is|Spurning '''um''' líf og dauða.|A question '''of''' life and death.}}
# [[through]], [[around]], [[across]]
#: {{ux|is|Áin rennur '''um''' dalinn.|The river runs '''through''' the valley.}}
#: {{ux|is|Að fara út '''um''' gluggann.|To go out '''through''' the window.}}
#: {{ux|is|Vestur '''um''' haf.|West '''across''' the sea.}}
# [[throughout]], [[over]], [[around]]
#: {{ux|is|Við förum '''um''' alla sveitina.|We'll go '''throughout''' the district.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hann var breiður '''um''' herðar.|He was broad '''across''' the shoulders.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hún hafði klút '''um''' hálsinn.|She had a scarf '''around''' her neck.}}
# [[during]], [[for]], [[in]], [[at]]
#: {{ux|is|Hvenær gerðist þetta?'' - ''Þetta gerðist '''um''' sumarið.|When did this happen? - It happened '''during''' the summer.}}
#: {{ux|is|Ég fór '''um''' nóttina.|I went '''during''' the night.}}
# [[approximately]], [[about]], [[around]]
#: {{ux|is|Pokinn er '''um''' fjögur kíló.|The bag is '''around''' four kilos.}}

====Usage notes====
* Often used with phrases such as "''[[brjóta heilann]] '''um'''''".
*: {{ux|is|Ég er búinn að [[brjóta heilann]] '''um''' þetta alla nótt!|I've been racking my brain '''about''' this all night!}}
